text: Raymond Thomas (Ray) Harford (1 June 1945 — 9 August 2003) is a former English football player. ==Career statistics== ===Playing statistics=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season Division League FA Cup Other Total Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Charlton Athletic 1965–66 Second Division 3 0 0 0 0 0 3 0 Exeter City 1965–66 Third Division 17 0 0 0 0 0 17 0 1966–67 Fourth Division 38 1 1 0 4 2 43 3 Total 55 1 1 0 4 2 60 3 Lincoln City 1967–68 Fourth Division 46 3 1 0 5 0 52 3 1968–69 Fourth Division 43 3 4 0 2 0 49 3 1969–70 Fourth Division 28 3 0 0 1 0 29 3 1970–71 Fourth Division 44 1 5 0 3 0 52 1 Total 161 10 10 0 11 0 182 10 Mansfield Town 1971–72 Third Division 7 0 0 0 2 0 9 0 Port Vale 1971–72 Third Division 19 1 0 0 0 0 19 1 1972–73 Third Division 1 0 0 0 0 0 1 0 Total 20 1 0 0 0 0 20 1 Colchester United 1972–73 Fourth Division 21 1 0 0 0 0 21 1 1973–74 Fourth Division 46 1 1 1 1 0 48 2 1974–75 Third Division 41 2 2 0 6 0 49 2 Total 108 4 3 1 7 0 118 5 Career total 354 16 14 1 24 2 392 19 ===Managerial statistics=== Managerial record by team and tenure Team From To Record Record Record Record Record Team From To Fulham 20 April 1984 10 June 1986 Luton Town 15 June 1987 3 January 1990 Wimbledon 18 June 1990 7 October 1991 Blackburn Rovers 25 June 1995 25 October 1996 West Bromwich Albion 6 February 1997 4 December 1997 Queens Park Rangers 5 December 1997 28 September 1998 Millwall (caretaker) 17 September 2000 25 September 2000 Total Total Total ==Honours== as a player with Colchester United *Football League Fourth Division promotion: 1973–74 *Colchester United F.C.
